name: Taj Mahal
description: A symbol of eternal love in Agra, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

name: Konark Sun Temple
description: A 13th-century Sun temple and UNESCO World Heritage Site in Odisha.

name: Hampi
description: Ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Karnataka.

name: Qutub Minar
description: A towering minaret built in the early 13th century in Delhi.

name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
description: A 1000-year-old Chola temple located in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu.

name: Meenakshi Temple
description: A historic Hindu temple in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi.

name: Golden Temple
description: The holiest Gurdwara of Sikhism, located in Amritsar, Punjab.

name: India Gate
description: A war memorial built in honor of Indian soldiers who died in World War I.

name: Ajanta Caves
description: Ancient Buddhist caves with stunning paintings and sculptures in Maharashtra.

name: Ellora Caves
description: Rock-cut cave temples representing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain religions.

name: Somnath Temple
description: One of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Shiva, located in Gujarat.

name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
description: A sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh.

name: Victoria Memorial
description: A white marble building in Kolkata, built in memory of Queen Victoria.

name: Charminar
description: An iconic mosque and monument located in Hyderabad, Telangana.

name: Mahabalipuram
description: Ancient port city famous for its rock-cut temples and sculptures in Tamil Nadu.

name: Ranakpur Jain Temple
description: A marble temple dedicated to Tirthankara Adinatha in Rajasthan.

name: Lotus Temple
description: A Baháʼí House of Worship in New Delhi known for its flower-like shape.

name: Kedarnath Temple
description: One of the holiest Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva in Uttarakhand.

name: Sun Temple Modhera
description: A beautifully carved temple dedicated to the Sun God in Gujarat.

name: Sanchi Stupa
description: An ancient Buddhist complex and UNESCO site in Madhya Pradesh.

name: Gateway of India
description: An iconic arch-monument built during the 20th century in Mumbai, Maharashtra.

name: Jagannath Temple
description: One of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites, located in Puri, Odisha.

name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
description: Famous for erotic sculptures and fine temple architecture in Madhya Pradesh.

name: Gol Gumbaz
description: A massive domed mausoleum of Mohammed Adil Shah in Karnataka.

name: Badrinath Temple
description: One of the Char Dham temples dedicated to Lord Vishnu, in Uttarakhand.

name: Nalanda University Ruins
description: An ancient seat of learning and Buddhist university in Bihar.

name: Rani ki Vav
description: An intricately constructed stepwell on the Saraswati river in Gujarat.

name: Sundarbans National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the world’s largest mangrove forest.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: A beautiful pink sandstone palace in Jaipur, Rajasthan, with 953 windows.

name: Virupaksha Temple
description: A 7th-century temple in Hampi dedicated to Lord Shiva, still active today.

name: Shore Temple
description: A granite temple built during the Pallava dynasty in Mahabalipuram.

name: Jaisalmer Fort
description: A UNESCO fort built in yellow sandstone in the heart of the Thar Desert.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
description: A UNESCO-listed Baroque church in Old Goa holding St. Francis Xavier's remains.

name: Tawang Monastery
description: The largest monastery in India, located in Arunachal Pradesh.

name: Sanchi Great Bowl
description: An ancient monastic relic bowl carved from a single stone in Madhya Pradesh.

name: Ajmer Sharif Dargah
description: A revered Sufi shrine of Moinuddin Chishti in Ajmer, Rajasthan.

name: Thanjavur Palace
description: A historical palace complex of the Nayak and Maratha rulers in Tamil Nadu.

name: Rajgir Vulture's Peak
description: A spiritual site associated with Lord Buddha’s teachings in Bihar.

name: Ujjain Mahakaleshwar Temple
description: One of the 12 Jyotirlinga shrines of Shiva, located in Madhya Pradesh.

name: Lingaraja Temple
description: A major Shaivite temple and architectural masterpiece in Bhubaneswar, Odisha.
